reviews.text: I travelled to Amsterdam with two female friends to celebrate the end of university in June 2006. After reading the reviews of this hotel we were really worried about booking a short break here. However, we decided to go for it, as it wasn't expensive and looked like a good location.
reviews.title: great room, great location, great time!

reviews.text: We arrived in Amsterdam and caught the train to Amsterdam centraal station in the evening. We were amazed at how easy the hotel was to find, and when we arrived, we were greeted by the hotel staff who were friendly, and spoke good english. We had booked a room that could accomodate three of us, and when we got to the room we found that there were three beds, the room was clean and cool and did not smell (as some past reviewers have found) and we had been provided with fresh towels and a fan to keep us cool. The hotel is perfectly placed, as it is right in the middle of the city. All roads lead back to Damrak, so it is very hard to get lost. It is close to the red light district, but not so close that you cannot easily avoid it if you wanted, and public transport is very close (with the station at the end of the road, and trams passing the hotel door every few minutes)
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.text: We were concerned about the hotel being noisy at night, because it was right on a main street, and our room was at the front, however we found that with the window closed, we were not disturbed by outside noise at all. We always felt safe in the hotel, and had no problem with fellow guests, althogh at times, as three young women, we were very aware of the drunk men who wander the streets of amsterdam looking for women at night (girls, ALWAYS stick together in the street, especially at night as it did not always feel very safe.)
reviews.title: Nice hotel will stay there again

reviews.text: Breakfast is served between 7am and 10am in the downstairs restaurant (which is full of character and charm) and consists of cornflakes or rolls with jam, and various hams and cheese etc. It is basic but nice, and there is fresh tea, coffee and juice.
reviews.title: Come on, not that bad, just get st*ned...
40 euro? What do you expect!
reviews.text: All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at hotel Damrak. I'm not saying that its perfect, but for a basic two star cheap hotel, you cannot beat it. We had a very enjoyable stay, and if i come back to Amsterdam, I would not hesitate to book ths hotel again.
Friends booked the Damrak for a long weekend with us. After reading the reviews here I was worried to say the least.
reviews.title: Could have been awful...but...

reviews.text: The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the central station and is very easy to find. The girl at reception was welcoming, informative and friendly. We were given rooms 15 and 16 and they were sadly what I had feared from reading the reviews here. The furniture was old,dark and in a bad state, the carpet was so old and dirty that you wouldnt want to walk on it barefooted. There were electrical wires hanging from an old hair dryer in the bathroom. The rooms both stunk of stale cigarette smoke.
reviews.title: Location best feature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We told the receptionist that we were non-smokers and would like to change rooms and she was really obliging. She immediately offered us some other rooms - 45 and 55. We checked these out and it was like a different hotel. The top 2 floors are completely renovated. New floors, carpets, beds and furnishings. The rooms were light and modern. We were so relieved and really enjoyed our stay. Strangely though they didnt seem to have really bothered to do up the bathrooms, but they were fine albeit really tiny.
reviews.title: Disappointed on return to this hotel...

likes.disliked: — the room itself and the customer service (or lack thereof)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were Bread rolls, ham, cheese and jam. Cereal, Coffee and juice. Not great but ok for a continental breakfast in a budget hotel. Cooked breakfasts were available at the menu prices. We tended to have a quick bite and then brunch somewhere nice a bit later in the morning. Dont miss the 'Pompadour' in the Nine Streets for amazing cakes and coffee ! Do miss the Metz restaurant with its uninspiring and overpriced food and inattentive staff.
reviews.title: Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff let us store our bags all day in a locked cellar room on the day that we checked out.
reviews.title: Great location - but that's it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely not recommend this hotel at all. Its supposed to be a '3 star' hotel! The rooms and bathrooms are not the cleanist. The sheets are not changed, the towels are not changed and best of all..... There was a mouse in my room and I was told that Amsterdam has a mouse problem so tough and all you get is a mouse trap. I asked for another room and there wasn't any, however they did offer me a room in one of their sister hotels, a 1 star hotel with a bunk bed and a shared toilet (now if the Damrak is a 3 star, I dred to think what the 1 star would be like) I wanted to leave this disguisting hotel but they wouldn't refund me any money and as it wasn't a cheap hotel, I couldn't aford to get another hotel at the time. I also asked to speak to the manager but conveniently he had gone home and wouldn't be returning until I was on the plane home! And to top it off I didn't even get an apology!
reviews.title: Do not stay here Ever

reviews.text: Only arrived home yesterday.
reviews.title: Pleasantly dam(rak) surprised
Damrak hotel is the best
reviews.text: Having read previous reviews we were wary about checking in. However, the hotel was very easy to find from Central Station (about 5 mins walk). The receptionist was very friendly and dealth with us politely. She even allowed us to view the rooms before we agreed to stay there. The rooms aren't the biggest, but they were comfortable. The bedding was clean, and the towels changed daily. The hotel is right accross the road from the Grasshopper cafe if you want to sample the coffee shop atmosphere and about 10 mins from the red light district. We found this hotel to be very central and close to all amenities like Central Station and the canal cruises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are losts of eating places nearby which cater for all tastes - Macdonalds, KFC, Indian, Chinese, Steaks. Please try any of the pastry shops behind the Grasshopper, they are wonderful. I would also recommend the pizza slices and the hotdogs, especially with cheese and mushrooms.
reviews.title: Never ever ever stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in the hotel was continental but full english was offered for a price. We didn't try the full breakfast but we were only there for 4 days. Any longer and I would have tried a cooked breakfast. Although the rolls, cold meats and cheese are the norm for continental hotels, a bacon piece would have been nice.
reviews.title: Ran Out Crying
good location and good value
reviews.text: me n my boyfriend have just came back from amsterdam. It was brilliant and we are planning to go again. Damrak Hotel was a good location and very close to all the main shops.The room was small but ok. The staff were very polite and friendly and the restaurant had a nice atmosphere too.

reviews.title: Could not fault the hotel - Will use again
reviews.text: After reading reviews on Tripadvisor was little weary of going to the DAMRAK HOTEL , I do not know what we were worrying about. The hotel room was clean, better than some ive stayed in in Amsterdam. The receptionist asked us ( 3 men - aging 38/43/50) to inspect the room before paying. We were in room 42 4th floor. The lift was out of order when we were there but was not a problem for us. WILL use this hotel again without a doubt. Those who complained on this site must have gone to a different hotel to us?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel. VERY central to train station / Red light/ Dam Sq.
reviews.title: Hotel Damrak (dont b confused with Damrak Inn)

likes.liked: — Location, Good Clean Rooms, Lovely And Warm, Not Noisy
likes.disliked: — THE SHOWER, but it was probably cos my bfriend took so long in there!

reviews.text: My partner and i went to amsterdam last Wednesday and stayed until Tuesday. We were staying at a 4* hotel called the Gresham Memphis, which we got a really good deal with thanks to a website, however the last night (Monday) they we're charging us double what we'd paid for all the previous nights. So we decided to have a look for hotels around The Dam and Central station for the last night, We got a twin room for 85Euros.
reviews.title: run away

reviews.text: We decided to stay here because friends of ours had for the last 4 years and when we spoke to them they said the Hotel Damrak has some new rooms and some older rooms. We had a modern new room which apart from the bathroom was just as good as the 4* we were previously staying in.
reviews.title: What a hotel.
